oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Nashville Cats program - Lloyd Green- 2006-02-18
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview program on the life and career to date of musician Lloyd Green from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on February 18, 2006.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Lloyd Green;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening comments from Ali Tonn. Hosted by Bill Lloyd. Includes selected excerpts from recordings and audio from video. Subjects include; Appearing with Charley Pride on the Lawrence Welk television show -- Learning the instrument -- Early influences -- Hearing the song Slowly by Webb Pierce and modifying his steel guitar -- Playing professionally at the age of ten -- Formal education -- Mom Upchurch's boarding house -- Getting his first job with Faron Young the day of arrival in Nashville -- First engagement with Faron breaking his tailbone -- First recording session being George Jones -- Moving back to Mobile - Moving back to Nashville -- Working at shoe store selling shoes --Widow of Fred Rose paying his musician union dues -- Playing SESAC master and demonstration sessions -- Playing Screen Gems demos for Tony Moon -- Warner Mack wanting Lloyd for recording session over Owen Bradley's objection -- Aubrey Mayhew with briefcase full of gold coins --

Little Darling records and Johnny Paycheck -- Story behind the photograph for the Cool Steel Man album -- Story about his brand new 1968 Cadillac -- Wembley Festival appearance in England -- Working with Paul McCartney -- Appearing on the Grand Ole Opry with the Byrds -- Attire in the recording studio -- Story about removing a neck and adding the rest pad on his steel guitar -- Pedal Steel demonstration -- Demonstrates his playing on Warner Mack's The Bridge Washed Out; Tammy Wynette's D.I.V.O.R.C.E.; Playing with an attitude -- Demonstrates his playing on Johnny Paycheck's Jukebox Charlie -- Playing dobro with Don Williams -- Demonstrates his playing on Farewell Party by Gene Watson -- Flatt and Scruggs television shows appearance story - Recording with Charley Pride at Panther Hall -- Lloyd's early retirement in 1988 due to medical issue and his comeback in 2002 -- Most recent and upcoming work -- Closing comments.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Green, Lloyd; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
